Description: Textile fragment; torn strip of undyed linen cloth; medium quality. One end divided into two with knots joining two further strips (probably originally the other end of the same cloth); rolled and whipped hem. The sewing thread is S-spun in groups of three. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.39 ends per 10mm and weft 13 picks per 10mm. Edges are torn, except where hemmed. Possibly from a very early mummy.
Curator's comments: The hem may contain a looped fringe of the Middle Kingdom type. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
